English Definition: an enclosed space, surrounded by seating for spectators, in which a sport, performance, or show takes place
a roped enclosure for boxing or wrestling
(the ring) the profession, sport, or institution of boxing
an official who watches a game or match closely to ensure that the rules are adhered to and (in some sports) to arbitrate on matters arising from the play
British a person willing to testify in writing about the character or ability of someone, especially an applicant for a job
act as the referee of
Chess a position in which a player's king is directly attacked by an opponent's piece or pawn and has no possible move to escape the check. The attacking player thus wins the game
Chess put into checkmate
high renown or honour won by notable achievements
relating to or affecting the muscles
having well-developed muscles
vigorously robust
strike with the fist
occur in turn repeatedly
the action or practice of inflicting severe pain or suffering on someone as a punishment or in order to force them to do or say something
great physical or mental suffering or anxiety
[no object] (of a volcano) become active and eject lava, ash, and gases
break out suddenly and dramatically
giving rise or likely to give rise to controversy or public disagreement
a figure or token used to make moves in a board game
a way of carrying out a particular task, especially the execution or performance of an artistic work or a scientific procedure
[mass noun] skill or ability in a particular field
a fundamental truth or proposition that serves as the foundation for a system of belief or behaviour or for a chain of reasoning
a general scientific theorem or law that has numerous special applications across a wide field
a fundamental source or basis of something
a mound or ridge of sand or other loose sediment formed by the wind, especially on the sea coast or in a desert
form (fabric or a fabric item) by interlacing long threads passing in one direction with others at a right angle to them
twist and turn from side to side while moving somewhere in order to avoid obstructions
begin a course of action
a sudden feeling of excitement and pleasure
the sloping surface of a mountain
a light, narrow boat with pointed ends and no keel, propelled with a paddle or paddles

a cloth canopy which fills with air and allows a person or heavy object attached to it to descend slowly when dropped from an aircraft, or which is released from the rear of an aircraft on landing to act as a brake
drop from an aircraft by parachute
fill (someone) with the urge or ability to do or feel something, especially to do something creative
[with object] dated be involved with (someone) romantically, with the intention of marrying
a particular form of something differing in certain respects from an earlier form or other forms of the same type of thing
a thing that blocks one's way or prevents or hinders progress
(usually tracks) a mark or line of marks left by a person, animal, or vehicle in passing
a ride on someone's back and shoulders
